title: Kernel dies unexpectedly when importing DeepLabCut-CPU on Windows or Mac
body:
My OS: Anaconda environment Python 3.6 or 3.7 OS: MacOS 10.15.1 (Catalina), MacBook Pro (Retina, 15-inch, Mid 2014) 2.2 GHz Quad-Core Intel Core i7, 16 GB 1600 MHz DDR3. Confirmed on other MacOS Macbook Pros and Windows 10 Laptops DeeplabCut versions 2.1.6, 2.1.7, 2.1.8, 2.1.9 Anaconda env used: DLC-CPU: name: DLC-CPU dependencies: - python=3.6 or 3.7 - pip - jupyter - nb_conda - tensorflow==1.12.0 up to 1.13.x - wxpython - Shapely - pip: - deeplabcut==2.1.6 to 2.1.9 **Describe the problem** When importing DeepLabCut in Jupyter notebook using import deeplabcut, the kernel timesout, then dies, restarting. There are no useful STDOUT error messages when running jupyter notebook --debug: The following output occurs when import deeplabcut is run:
STDOUT output from jupyter notebook --debug when kernel dies

[D 13:36:26.903 NotebookApp] activity on 0b50f062-539f-413f-b237-ca05e554483f: execute_input [D 13:36:27.915 NotebookApp] 304 GET /static/base/images/favicon-busy-1.ico (::1) 0.96ms [D 13:36:39.104 NotebookApp] activity on 0b50f062-539f-413f-b237-ca05e554483f: status (idle) [I 13:36:41.942 NotebookApp] KernelRestarter: restarting kernel (1/5), keep random ports WARNING:root:kernel 0b50f062-539f-413f-b237-ca05e554483f restarted [D 13:36:41.943 NotebookApp] Starting kernel: ['/Users/chris/opt/anaconda3/envs/DLC-CPU/bin/python', '-m', 'ipykernel_launcher', '-f', '/Users/chris/Library/Jupyter/runtime/kernel-0b50f062-539f-413f-b237-ca05e554483f.json'] [D 13:36:41.946 NotebookApp] Connecting to: tcp://127.0.0.1:60934 [D 13:36:44.955 NotebookApp] KernelRestarter: restart apparently succeeded

**How to Reproduce the problem** Steps to reproduce the behavior: 1. Install DeepLabCut-CPU with conda env create -f DLC-CPU.yaml 2. Launch a Jupyter notebook 3. execute cell with import deeplabcut 4. See error **Additional context** We tried DLC-CPU this on other Macbook pros, Windows 10 Laptops, and the same kernel dies in those environments as well with the most recent .yaml easy installs.
